alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 4:56PM MST until July 24 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Antelope Creek basin in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST. * At 456 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Antelope Creek basin. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Antelope Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Antelope Creek basin. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Page, Antelope Creek Basin, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Antelope Canyon, Lake Powell and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following slot canyons... Upper Antelope Canyon, Lower Antelope Canyon, Canyon X, Cardiac Canyon, Owl Canyon, Rattlesnake Canyon, Mountain Sheep Canyon, Ramshead Canyon, Wind Pebble Canyon and Porcupine Canyon. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Antelope Creek, Kaibito Creek, Sand Wash and Peach Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get out of Antelope Canyon and other area slot canyons immediately! Deadly flash flooding is imminent or occurring! Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Get out of washes and creeks if you are hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
